result.execSummary:
The defendant Allison H. Piontek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
$300.00 BOND APPLIED TO COSTS, BALANCE DUE $586.00.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician. No possession of drug paraphernalia. No intoxicants. Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No association with known drug dealers.

Complete compas assessment, counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.  Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED AND STAYED. On each count concurrent. Stay may be lifted, in whole or in part, upon written request of the agent with approval and order of the court.
